medical_history.chief_complaint: Mr A needs surgery for presumed colon cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In December 2005, Mr A underwent a colonoscopy due to a single episode of melena, which revealed a malignant-appearing sigmoid mass. He has a chronic cough producing copious gray sputum and has had numerous episodes of bronchitis and upper respiratory tract infections. His exercise capacity is limited by peripheral vascular disease.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mr A has severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), coronary artery disease, peripheral vascular disease, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and a history of melena. Previous colonoscopies in 2001 showed 2 small polyps. He has had multiple hospitalizations for COPD but no intubations.
medical_history.social_history: Mr A is a long-term smoker (75-pack-year history), drinks several alcoholic beverages daily, and is trying to cut down on smoking. He works full-time as a security guard and lives with his wife.
